intro: Tricalysia obovata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Tricalysia obovata is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
